settings.name: content
settings.value: Getting started with our tool is simple and straightforward. Here's a step-by-step guide on how to install and set up the extension on Visual Studio Code.
settings.computedValue: Getting started with our tool is simple and straightforward. Here's a step-by-step guide on how to install and set up the extension on Visual Studio Code.

settings.name: content
settings.value:
Before you begin, ensure that you have the following installed on your system:

  1. The latest version of Visual Studio Code. Our tool is compatible with all platforms that VS Code supports, including Windows, macOS, and Linux.
  2. Docker: Docker is a platform that allows you to automate the deployment, scaling, and management of applications. You can download Docker from the official Docker website.
  3. Docker Compose: Docker Compose is a tool for defining and running multi-container Docker applications. It uses YAML files to configure the application's services and performs the creation and start-up process of all the containers with a single command. You can download Docker Compose from the Docker website.
settings.computedValue:
Before you begin, ensure that you have the following installed on your system:

  1. The latest version of Visual Studio Code. Our tool is compatible with all platforms that VS Code supports, including Windows, macOS, and Linux.
  2. Docker: Docker is a platform that allows you to automate the deployment, scaling, and management of applications. You can download Docker from the official Docker website.
  3. Docker Compose: Docker Compose is a tool for defining and running multi-container Docker applications. It uses YAML files to configure the application's services and performs the creation and start-up process of all the containers with a single command. You can download Docker Compose from the Docker website.

settings.name: content
settings.value:
1. Open Visual Studio Code: Launch your Visual Studio Code editor.
  2. Access Extension Marketplace: Navigate to the Extensions view by clicking on the Extensions icon in the Activity Bar on the side of the window.
  3. Search for Our Tool: In the Extensions view search box, type the name of our tool. This will bring up a list of matching results.
  4. Install Our Tool: Find our tool in the search results and click on the install button.
  5. Confirm Installation: Once the installation is complete, you will see an uninstall button in place of the install button. This confirms that the tool has been installed successfully.
  6. Reload Visual Studio Code: After the installation is complete, reload Visual Studio Code to activate the extension.
settings.computedValue:
1. Open Visual Studio Code: Launch your Visual Studio Code editor.
  2. Access Extension Marketplace: Navigate to the Extensions view by clicking on the Extensions icon in the Activity Bar on the side of the window.
  3. Search for Our Tool: In the Extensions view search box, type the name of our tool. This will bring up a list of matching results.
  4. Install Our Tool: Find our tool in the search results and click on the install button.
  5. Confirm Installation: Once the installation is complete, you will see an uninstall button in place of the install button. This confirms that the tool has been installed successfully.
  6. Reload Visual Studio Code: After the installation is complete, reload Visual Studio Code to activate the extension.

settings.name: content
settings.value:
Now, our tool is ready to use. In the following sections, you will find detailed information about how to use our tool to simplify your code, reduce duplication, and identify security vulnerabilities.

For any installation issues, please refer to the Troubleshooting section or feel free to reach out to our support team. We're here to assist you in your journey towards more sustainable software development.
